case_name: TABMAN v. FEDERAL BUREAU OF INVESTIGATION

docket_entries.description: SUMMONS (4) Issued as to FEDERAL BUREAU OF INVESTIGATION, JOHN PISTOLE, U.S. Attorney and U.S. Attorney General (td, )
COMPLAINT against FEDERAL BUREAU OF INVESTIGATION, JOHN PISTOLE ( Filing fee $ 350, receipt number 4616017171) filed by MICHAEL TABMAN. (Attachments: # (1) Civil Cover Sheet)(td, )

Set/Reset Deadlines: Plaintiff shall either cause process to be served and proof of service to be filed with the Court, or file a status report advising why service has not been made by 5/20/2009. (mm)

ORDER that on or before May 20, 2009, plaintiff either cause process to be served and proof of service to be filed with the Court, or file a status report with the Court advising why service has not been made. Signed by Judge Paul L. Friedman on May 11, 2009. (MA)

MINUTE ORDER granting [15] plaintiff's consent motion for an enlargement of time to file an amended complaint. Plaintiff may file an amended complaint on or before Monday, November 2, 2009. Plaintiff is advised that for so long as this case remains separate from Civil Action No. 09-880, with a separate docket, he is not to combine in one filing motions regarding more than one of the cases. Signed by Judge Paul L. Friedman on October 5, 2009. (MA)

docket_entries.description: MINUTE ORDER: In light of plaintiff's consent motion for an enlargement of time to file an opposition to defendants' motion to dismiss, it is hereby ordered that plaintiff's opposition to the motion to dismiss is now due on or before February 1, 2010 and defendants' reply is now due on or before March 2, 2010. Signed by Judge Paul L. Friedman on January 22, 2010. (MA)

docket_entries.description: OPINION dismissing Counts One and Two of plaintiff's complaint and granting summary judgment for the defendants on Count three of the complaint. An order consistent with this opinion will issue this same day. Signed by Judge Paul L. Friedman on June 22, 2010. (MA)
